portfolio.title: Learning Unity Fundamentals
portfolio.summary: Finished the tutorial for Unity Essentials and published a WebGL version of some scenes demonstrating the addition of basic physics to 3D objects, making prefabs with primitive shapes, adding 2D and 3D sound, adding scripts to GameObjects, and more.

portfolio.title: Financial Services Company
portfolio.summary: Constructed a proof of concept cross-platform finance management application that can be deployed to Android, iOS, and web from a single code base using React Native, Typescript, Redux, and Tailwind.  It was a complete UI redesign meant to utilize a new design kit that could be consistently applied to the user experience while consuming existing APIs.
portfolio.contribution: Contribution: - Developed ADA compliant UI components with unit tests in Storybook using designs in Figma - Worked in a UI team of 5 members, took individual responsibility for implementing several components and screens, including forms using Formik and Yup for validation - Challenged discrepancies between API data availability and business requirements, identifying gaps in the UX in advance of client presentations - Verified complex requirements with design, business, backend, and QA teams, requested updates when needed

portfolio.title: IBM, Workplace Credentials
portfolio.summary: Developed a white-label application with an API-only option for companies to verify employee Covid vaccination credentials.
portfolio.contribution: Contribution: - Implemented functionality to read an uploaded QR code's data and populate data into a form - Updated copy for i18n and client specific configurations for the UI - Customized Carbon design kit components, collaborated with design team to find reasonable solutions

portfolio.title: New-York Historical Society, WAMS
portfolio.summary: This was my second engagement as the sole developer with the WAMS team after having implemented the redesign of their curriculum pages, which is the bulk of their site. This round of updates included adding curriculum templates in Wordpress for the client to add content to. Our team also designed and developed a responsive timeline of historical events, as well as a user walkthrough of the homepage for first-time users.
portfolio.contribution: Contribution: - Worked closely with UX and design to develop impactful but feasible solutions that the client could easily manage after handing off the site - Added a mini React implementation inside of a Wordpress template for the event timeline. - Wrote the user walkthrough in vanilla JS to control modals and manipulate existing Wordpress modules - Cleaned up SASS files to better manage color variables for the design library - Manually added large amounts of content in HTML templates for the client

portfolio.title: New York State, Excelsior Pass
portfolio.summary: I was part of a small team that developed a web application for New York State that verified Covid vaccination credentials based on New York state's data received from health providers statewide and allowed the user to present an encrypted QR code stored in their digital wallet.
portfolio.contribution: Contribution: - Wrote and reviewed Angular code for front end design updates - Added logic to backend services in Express to accommodate 3+ vaccine credentials for a user while handling several cases for bad or non normalized data - Used IBM Cloud to deploy application across environments

portfolio.title: The Aesthetic Society
portfolio.summary: A complete rebuild for the Aesthetic Society's website which included multiple Design Thinking sessions with the client and patients. The sessions led to the complete reimagining of the UX and UI design, including the homepage, image galleries, surgeon search, and education pages
portfolio.contribution: Contribution: - Led offshore UI team, advised on front end decisions - Liaisoned between design and UI team  - Implemented React components within a Drupal application - Creatively solutioned UI components that were output from Drupal modules

portfolio.title: Chase, Retail Structured Products
portfolio.summary: Our team worked directly with the client developers to build a new, internal application for bankers to calculate values for retail structured products during client conversations.
portfolio.contribution: Contribution: - Helped to define team best practices, procedures, and style guides that were adopted by the client. - Increased UI unit test coverage from 0 to 85%.  - Implemented ADA compliant code. Communicated extensively with the client's ADA team to reach satisfactory solutions - Collaborated with BAs, visual designers, and UX teams to arrive at user friendly solutions. - Led the UI team by talking through code problems and code review. - Implemented Browserify as a solution to adding bundling and ES6 transpiling to the UI code base

portfolio.title: State Street
portfolio.summary: This was a brief engagement with a team of 6 to build a proof of concept for an internal State Street application.  The project kicked off with the Design Thinking process and as the sole developer, I was responsible for the web implementation of a happy path through an Excel-like application.
portfolio.contribution: - Built a functional prototype using AngularJS for a software experience based on wireframe and visual design requirements - Used the InteractJS library to mimic a Windows-like desktop in which panes could be dragged around and resized - Developed according to UX 'happy paths' to demonstrate end product's key functionality - Presented functionality to the client at bi weekly meetings

portfolio.title: My Coke Rewards
portfolio.summary: Our team was tasked with new development for the front and backend of My Coke Reward's website, including their sub brands.  We had two primary tasks which were to create and monitor seasonal campaigns, and also to create responsive, reusable components that could be applied across the brands in Adobe CQ (now known as AEM).
portfolio.contribution: Contribution: - UI Development using jQuery for three My Coke Reward campaign pages which were based around social media content on Instagram and Twitter - Created responsive components using vanilla css and helped with integration in their Adobe CQ platform - Joined defect triage meetings and fixed issues
